website_summaries.verdict: A compact audio splitter that delivers a terrific blend of affordability and quality.
pros: Sturdy splitter can withstand accidental pulls
Features braided cables that bend and resist wear over time
Equipped with gold-plated connectors to enhance sound quality
Designed for use with devices from Samsung, Blackberry, and other globally recognized brands
cons: Microphone jack may stop working at times
May result in echo or buzzing sounds during use

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: I was needing an adapter that would allow me to use my Turtle Beach XO Seven Xbox One headset with my PC and this product is exactly what I was looking for. I just plugged in the male end of headset into the female end of this adapter and then plugged the two male ends of the adapter into the microphone and speaker jacks on the back of the PC and that's all it took. Saved me the money of having to buy another gaming headset. The quality of this adapter looks very good as well. Very pleased with this product!
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: It Works Great
customer_reviews.text: My original review was a one star because what we received was unusable. Was ready to cut my loses when the company immediately sent a replacement at no extra cost to us. It works!....perfectly. Very satisfied with the product and the company's quick response to make good on a bad unit.
customer_reviews.author: J Crotts

customer_reviews.title: Works just as I expected
customer_reviews.text: My son is using a standard cellphone headset connected to this adapter that's plugged into his pc so he can play that god-forsaken game Fortnite! In a way, I wish this adapter WOULD break, then he might not play that stupid game all the time! I'm kidding! But this does work well for both earphones and mic on a pc, just need to make sure to go in and tweak your sound and mic settings in windows. You may need to boost the mic settings slightly (I think I have it set at +10db boost on his machine).
customer_reviews.author: Flyin'Hawaiian

customer_reviews.title: TRRS & CTIA
customer_reviews.text: This splitter is designed to work with compatible TRRS-CTIA devices, which means the device you are trying to split in Mic and Audio, has to be a TRRS (3 black rings and 4 copper poles) and CTIA configuration. See figure provided by MillSO
customer_reviews.author: VMP

customer_reviews.title: Edited Review: after a few months of use, the line out left went bad.
customer_reviews.text: One of the leads went bad after a few months of use. I can wiggle it while its plugged in and can hear the sound cut in and out on the left side. The line hasn't been moved or subjected to any damage (it was in the back of a PC for months) and still the wiring fell apart. I'll end up buying another, but I urge caution. Review of cable number 2: This one also went bad after exactly 3 months of use. I don't know how this item has 5 stars. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use with my office computer at work since the COVID-19 pandemic means I sometimes still have to attend remote meetings even when other attendees are on site. My computer has a separate headphone jack and microphone jack and has no Bluetooth for wireless earbuds. This splitter has ended up working perfectly—I have a pair of earbuds with a microphone that have worked great for my last couple of meetings. Occasionally I get a little bit of static but it's usually because one of the connections has come loose and I just need to wiggle the plug a bit. Great product for the price, as far as I can tell.
customer_reviews.author: EJF

customer_reviews.title: Works With PS4. Reduce controller Lag
customer_reviews.text: Plug and play with PS4 perfectly. Used a usb extension with this. SYBA external USB Stereo Sound Adapter for Windows, Mac, Linux Extra Audio Source with Microphone SD-CM-UAUD  AmazonBasics USB 3.0 Extension Cable - A-Male to A-Female - 3.3 Feet (1 Meter)  NOTE: this will actually reduce controller Lag. I noticed when plugging headphones into the controller it added a delay. Problem fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy V

customer_reviews.title: Functional.
customer_reviews.text: Does what it needs to. For people who are using headsets with four-pole / "TRRS" phone connectors they do exactly as you'd expect. No reverse stereo issues, microphone works flawlessly. ...Unless you use an Apple product, then since it works flawlessly with OMTP-standard audio receivers, CTIA users should beware of this and provision use of a CTIA microphone adapter for OMTP devices or purchase compatible two-pole phone adapters which can be paired with bare wire to swap mic hot and ground.
customer_reviews.author: Technologic

customer_reviews.title: We're very happy with this
customer_reviews.text: We needed a way for my wife to use zoom to attend on-line classes during the stay-at-home order here. She had some earphones with a mic that were use for hands-free cell phone operation while driving. This device enabled us to plug those earphones into the headphone and mic jacks of our desktop computer to give her both listening and speaking capability to use with Zoom. It works great and we're very happy we didn't have to buy a dedicated microphone as this setup has excellent sound quality and enabled us to use what we already had on hand.
customer_reviews.author: Chicago John

customer_reviews.title: Headset Splitter that works as one would think! Braided cable is welcoming!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a Headset Splitter cable so that I can use the microphone on my earbuds with my laptop, that otherwise utilized a combo headphone/microphone plug which wasn't compatible with my aging Lenovo Y510P. I bought this and it arrived in the mail in a small bag. The packaging was deceptively sturdy to my surprise, and so was the cable. The cable was built solidly, thanks to the braided body, and worked as expected. Safe to say it wasn't DoA. Overall, not much else to say except this is a solid splitter. It's well built & gets the job done!
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Works with Logitech 3.5 mm Analog Stereo Headset H151 for desktop PC use
customer_reviews.text: Build quality for this adapter seems good. I like the two different colored tips. That makes it easier to plug things in beneath a desk where it can be hard to see. This adapter allows the same set of Logitech 3.5 mm Analog Stereo Headset H151 with Boom Microphone headphones work with my child's desktop computer (PC) as well as his phone. The standards are different for a phone's headphone jack vs. the two jack set up on a computer (headphone out, microphone in.) We are using this for self- studying foreign languages at home. You learn better when you can hear your voice trying to replicate that of the native speaker.
customer_reviews.author: K. Levin

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: Does what it’s meant to do. My desktop has separate mic and audio ports and I have been having real trouble when I have to use the desktop to sit for online meetings as my headphone has only one mic+audio pin. On the other hand, my bluetooth headphone’s mic is just crappy with linux. This mic+audio adapter made my life much easier and the people on the other side of the calls said they could hear me very clearly. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Ashiq

customer_reviews.title: 2 Different Splitters - Both Trash
customer_reviews.text: First one ordered required the headphones to be pulled out slightly to get any sound out of them and was very positional. They were easily exchanged for another which had no issues with headphone audio. I finally tried to use the microphone today and got absolutely nothing from it. The mic works with my phone so it must be the splitter. I'm not sure how such a simple product can be made so poorly, but here we are. Definitely avoid this.
customer_reviews.author: oofy

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: Product Version: 3.5mm Audio Jack Y Cable Adapter -MillSO 1 x 3.5mm Female to 2 x 3.5mm Male for PC, PS4 Gaming Headset - 100CM Black Left and right are left and right, and the mic works! Not much else to say. The cable is braided white/black and has a nice feel to it. Very solid connection to my headset cable. I do wish I bought a longer version though. My PS4 headset has a very short cable, but the extra 100cm works as my ports are on the front of my PC.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan

customer_reviews.title: Works with standard earbuds, not iPhone ear buds.
customer_reviews.text: This works great to "combine" the mic and headphones from almost all ear buds I have tested with. Simply plug the red plug in your computer's mic port and the green plug in your computer's headphone port, then connect your earbuds (need to have the style with a mic) in and your good to go. Sound quality is as good as the earbuds allow, iow sounds the same as if I wasn't splitting out the mic. The one limitation is that it does not work with Apple's supplied earbuds for the iPhones. That is not the fault of this spitter, but a limitation of the Apple earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Guide

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for gaming.
customer_reviews.text: I kept having problems where my USB or Bluetooth headsets would not work in Windows games. I eventually ordered a cheap thin adapter like this from China and it worked great but broke quickly because it was so flimsy. I went on Amazon looking for a more sturdy looking one and chose this. Works perfectly and i have it combined with an extension cable. Now I can use any of my earbuds for gaming and it works perfectly. I am very happy with it! Time will tell how durable it is, but it seems to be very well built and i'm not worried about it breaking like I did with the old thin one.
customer_reviews.author: ( ﾟ▽ﾟ)

customer_reviews.title: works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say about a splitter that works... it works. The cable's quite short, the connections are solid to my headphone cable, and I have not noticed any problems caused by the splitter. I am using this splitter to make my wired headphones work on my laptop which requires both a mic in and a headset in, instead of the combo headset 3.5mm port some computers have.
customer_reviews.author: Critical Assessment

customer_reviews.title: Works better than the splitter that originally came with my headset.
customer_reviews.text: I've had a gaming headset for about a year, and just recently I lost the splitter that came with it. The reason why I lost it is because it never had a tight connection to the jack (which irritated me to no end). I picked this one up and honestly expected it to be just as loose, but I'm so happy that my assumption was wrong. It fits snuggly and I don't see me losing this splitter anytime soon. On top of the quality, the price is perfect and it shipped FAST! I'm super happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea S.

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Huge waste of my time. Bought this with the expectation that it’d work and allow me to use my Xbox One gaming headset on my PC. Unfortunately, after testing the product out with a couple of different PC’s, I’ve come to the realization that this is just an extremely poor quality product. Don’t spend your time and money on this product, instead, try something from a more reputable brand.
customer_reviews.author: Chris V.

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: Don't bother - I plugged it into a brand new headset that didn't come with an audio splitter and the microphone would not work. Spend your money on a headset that comes with the company's audio splitter or try to purchase it from the manufacturer, I threw this in the garbage on the same day it arrived.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for I guess
customer_reviews.text: welp. guess I'm the chosen one since I don't see that many people having issues with this adapter. the usual suspect, garbled sound and just overall piss poor quality audio from my pc. just like when a headphone cable breaks and if you move the cable a certain way the sound cuts in and out. yes I plugged them correctly, yes I've tried turning it off and back on again. it. does. not. work. properly.
customer_reviews.author: Not a Dog

customer_reviews.title: Works with Bose QC15 - provided you use the right cable
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to use my Bose QC15 headphones and mic on my PC and bought this adapter to accomplish that. My headphones came with two cables, one marked with an "S" on the back of the in-line mic and one without any marking. This adapter works perfectly, so long as I use the cable with the "S" marked on the microphone. While I cannot find any documentation, my recollection is that one of these cables is intended for certain Apple devices and the other for Samsung devices. They must use different 4-conductor standards and it appears the "S" version (Samsung presumably) uses the CTIA standard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item to allow my gaming headset connect to my new motherboard that only had separate mic and speaker/headphone jacks. This worked the first time and allowed all of the functions of my headset to work as expected. It also supports the Razer Black Widow gaming keyboard pass-through to connect the headset via the keyboard and keeping the cord length to a minimum.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Rosen

customer_reviews.title: Microphone doesnt work
customer_reviews.text: Looks good but the microphone in line doesnt work on my hyperx headphones. The female part of the connection seems a bit too small for the male part on the headphones. Sound is fine regardless of awkward fit but microphone is complete trash and basically all static
customer_reviews.author: troy raymond

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work
customer_reviews.text: Tried using it to plug in the standard headphones/mic that came with my galaxy S10 phone. These work great when plugged into the single audio/mic jack on both my phone and on my laptop. Connected this item to the headphone out and mic in lines on my desktop box. Then tried to connect the headset. First off, stereo audio only connected if I forced the connection together and held it - if I relaxed my hold the sound would drop or come in the right channel only. No position allowed my PC to pick up the microphone input, which, again, works fine on two other devices.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Lohman

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product for a short while and it seems good so far. The sound quality with my PC is good and I can use the mic with my headset no problem so for the money I can't complain. I didn't know this until it arrived but the cable is actually braided which I find to be a nice touch and should help this product last that much longer.
customer_reviews.author: Elvin

customer_reviews.title: Bring down your headsets audio quality
customer_reviews.text: I connected this to my PC and be able to use my headset, originally to be use it with Xbox. The adapter feels good, unfortunately brings dooown the quality audio of the headsets. I tried with a different adapter and the audio quality was better.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy M

customer_reviews.title: Great products
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased thousands of quality and not so great cabling products in the past. These seem to be of a high quality material, and work as advertised. I was impressed at the speed at which my order was fulfilled with basically a one day turn around. I really needed this to extend the reach of my son's gaming headphone. Works great! Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur P Rosenberg

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother.  Junk quality
customer_reviews.text: Jack where you plug headphones is super low quality. Doesn't make contact so the headphones won't work. Same headphones work perfect with every other devise. Buy a better quality product than this. Failed out of the box. Waste of time..
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: WHAT A WASTE !
customer_reviews.text: This cable should be avoided, AT ALL COST! There doesn't appear to be ANY shielding on the product as it emits HORRIBLE electrostatic reverb from the moment it gets plugged in. I suspect a huge fraud case, but since the product is so cheap, I'll merely report it to Amazon...seriously, avoid buying this.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: It works and has a useful length
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this to convert the single plug on my microphone/headphones to the two-plug system on my computer (the typical reason to buy this adapter). The cord length is convenient for me to use my Bose headphones and have a little room to move from the workstation it is plugged into.
customer_reviews.author: ET

customer_reviews.title: Perfect match with V-Moda BoomPro
customer_reviews.text: Needed an extra aux/mic splitter to use with my V-Moda BoomPro and my desktop. The MillSO splitter feels like it's made with high quality components and the colored tips make it extremely easy to match with the correct jacks. The braided cables are a nice touch as well. Sound quality and microphone input are perfectly clear. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Junstar

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and works
customer_reviews.text: I can finally use my gaming headset on my computer instead of just my Xbox! Works flawlessly, dirt cheap, and looks to be built well. Not much else to say, just plug in line in, line out, plug in your headset and you’re good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Tetelboim

customer_reviews.title: literally did not work for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of this product one for me and one for my boyfriend and we both tried it on both our PC but it didn't work. The sound worked fine, great in fact however the mic still doesn't work on our headphones. We can hear what other people are saying to us but we are not able to answer and when we do try, people say they can't hear us.
customer_reviews.author: Eva Tu

customer_reviews.title: A splitter was all we needed this entire time?!
customer_reviews.text: My son has never been able to make his headphone/combo mic to work in his old PC, nor his newly built one. I suggested we just buy some wireless ones that are usb. He looked into it and found this was what he has needed. He says he has good sound quality for headphones and mic with these and he's a satisfied gamer. Such a simple and cheap solution!
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: What am I going to do with these headphones?! ... this!
customer_reviews.text: Did exactly what I expected it to do; split a 3.5 dual speaker/mic jack into two separate jacks. I was gifted a cool headset with a mic built in but it only had one jack. It works nice with my PS4, but it's worthless as-is for PC gaming. I bought this splitter and it works mint. The braided cable seems pretty solid. I have a feeling between using and storing it will last a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: RH.Droid

customer_reviews.title: Great for online meetings
customer_reviews.text: I chose these because not only was the splitter color coded, it had the microphone and headphone embossed on the designated plug. The other splitters available only had it printed on the plug, which I’ve found is, that in time, they usually rub off.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Its a Splitter. It Works Well.
customer_reviews.text: Listen, quality is good, also a pretty decent price. You really can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: S Morgan Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Works Nicely
customer_reviews.text: This works perfectly for me. I bought the PS4 branded version of the HyperX Cloud headset and then this so I could use it with my PC. The splitter works perfectly but I wanted to mention that they didn't work at first because I didn't realize the jack was not all the way in. You gotta push it in with a bit of authority. But when you do, they work perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: CRGamble

customer_reviews.title: Stereo audio becomes broken using this with Bose QC 25
customer_reviews.text: The microphone does work on PC when using this, but it completely breaks stereo sound, and the quality is severely diminished. I opened up CS:GO after plugging this in, and all audio is played through both ears, and the sound is very muffled. I confirmed in my Realtek Audio Manager that sounds for both left and right ears were playing out of both ears. The issue was resolved when removing the splitter.
customer_reviews.author: Tim McManus

customer_reviews.title: Great for headset plugs
customer_reviews.text: I bought a few of these for converting 4 ring plugs that my headsets use to standard 2 jack devices and they all work great. Nice and flexible, but sturdy enough to not accidentally over stress the cord.
customer_reviews.author: B. PughTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Works as designed
customer_reviews.text: I bought myself a nice set of headphones for work, and they come with an integrated microphone on the cable. To make use of this mic for video conferencing I needed this splitter. I have tested it with zoom, skype, and slack and video conferencing works great. I detect no degradation in sound quality. This device works as designed/advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Ross Rustom Patel

customer_reviews.title: Does what it should,
customer_reviews.text: Had to get these because my headphones with microphone would not work without a splitter. It works but when recording you can barley hear what I am saying. I tried a different microphone in the microphone jack and the recording was loud and clear. I don't know if it is the splitter's fault or the headphone's fault so giving the higher rating to give the benefit of doubt.
customer_reviews.author: Deb S

customer_reviews.title: Quality and affordable.
customer_reviews.text: Cloth wrapped wire and quality plastic with good metal connectors. It does not add any signal distortion either. The longer version is great for using with a PC tower. The shorter version is better for a laptop or PC tower sitting on top of a desk.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Bought as a additional Christmas present for a friend and it works perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Like the title says, I bought it for a friend who uses a headset for his PS4 and was unable to use the same headset for his computer because the computer needs a separate mic and headphone plug(we tried it and could not hear each other). I heard him from the other end of it when he tested it out and he sounds good so I can say it works for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Compton B

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed and the price was right
customer_reviews.text: I also use the male 3.5 splitter, going to separate mic & headphone female connectors. This particular connector, I use 2 ways: 1) To connect my gaming headset to my computer 2) Along with the previously mentioned splitter, to run the headphone side through an amp to use my gaming headset with my Android phone. Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Kennylee

customer_reviews.title: It works great
customer_reviews.text: I've had this product for a couple of months and no complaint so far. The quality is really nice and it doesn't feel cheap to me at all. The cable has a para-cord feel to it and feels really well made. The sound quality is great i play a lot of video games and i can hear things really well and my teammates can here me pretty good as well. I Bought it for my headset with a mic and i'm not disappointed. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Josmar

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed. The sound quality is great, it's super simple to use and allows me to directly plug my headset in with no issues. My wife and I both work from home and this was required for our jobs so we can join online meetings. I am so glad that I found this item. Highly recommended and would purchase again if needed!
customer_reviews.author: Evie J

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: All 3 adapters I bought work great with my gaming headset and phone/laptop. MillSO Headset Splitter 3.5mm CTIA Jack Headset Adapter Mic and Audio Headphone Splitter Cable with Separate Microphone and Headphone Connector for Gaming Headset to PC - 8inch/20CM Black MillSO Headphone Splitter Adapter, 3.5mm Audio + Mic 4 Pole TRRS Splitter (3.5mm Male to 2X 3.5mm Female) Jack Y Cable
customer_reviews.author: David L

customer_reviews.title: Like Magic
customer_reviews.text: The computer has distinct ports for headphones and microphone, but the gamer headset with microphone boom (dreamGear) had a single plug. This adapter worked perfectly for splitting the single plug into individual plugs for the headphones and microphone. The adapter itself is well built with a braided cloth exterior that resists tangling. I opted not to rate "Volume control" as the device has no volume control. Volume control is done with the computer's headphone volume and this device neither boosted nor diminished the volume intensity.
customer_reviews.author: B. Shouse

customer_reviews.title: Works with Bose QC25 and Apple Pinouts
customer_reviews.text: Adapter works as intended, converting apple pinout 3.5mm headsets to standard speaker/mic pinouts without a noticeable loss in quality. Cable is braided and both ends have proper strain reliefs.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Turtle Beach Y Adapter
customer_reviews.text: My Turtle Beach PX24 headset didn't come with the right adapter for my computer and requires a splitter that can read all 4 parts on the jack. If I ever need another one, I'll be buy this again for sure.
customer_reviews.author: GoldenTail

customer_reviews.title: It is affordable and funtional.
customer_reviews.text: It seems to function as it should. The connection does not have any intermittent outages when moved around. I've not tested it in any dynamic or stereo situations to see if speaker orientation is correct. So far, I have only used it to convert my headset to a split format for my older machine for online phone calls/meetings. If I do find any future pros/cons, I will update my review.
customer_reviews.author: HastyChester

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: With the proliferation of smartphones, headsets have taken over and anybody with a PC with pink/green headphone/mic ports or car with an AUX in port needs this adapter. Decent price and appears to be decent quality, the important part is it does it's job; I can plug my headset into my laptop and my smartphone into my car stereo using this adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Universal 3.5mm jack to 2 3.5mm jacks. Great for desktop computers.
customer_reviews.text: My turtle beach audio controller/extender broke and my pc desktop does not have a universal port. I also like to sometimes wear earphones instead of a headset. This let's me use the universal Jack with my pc by converting to the green and red jacks for microphone and audio. Sound is great, cable feels durable, and is simple to connect.
customer_reviews.author: Cvn97

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and works well
customer_reviews.text: I'm unexpectedly surprised by the over all great quality of this slitter. It works exactly how intended, splitting headphone audio and mic out to my computer for plug in. I knew it would work, but I didn't expect this solid of a cable and ends for such a low price. Absolutely recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Scott

customer_reviews.title: Works after fixing connection issue!
customer_reviews.text: Low priced, length was what I needed, works but I had to twist the connections, so knocked off a star. So if your not getting any sound or mic not working, that was what I had to do. Connected to the inputs of my Creative Sound BlasterX AE-5 in my PC, using the single analog connection for my Logitech G933 Artemis.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S. Owens

customer_reviews.title: Broke after less than a year... Replaced for free
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine. Lasted less than a year before crapping out. Not bad I guess for the price. Update: MIllSO contacted me and gave me a 99% off code for the new design. Hopefully this one lasts longer +1 star
customer_reviews.author: Steven C.

customer_reviews.title: Money Saver
customer_reviews.text: Money saver right here. I had an Xbox headset, but need to split the microphone and headset to use it on my PC. Great alternative to buying a different headset (and now I don't have an extra headset taking up space).
customer_reviews.author: Alex Marks

customer_reviews.title: The female receptacle is not a tight fit.
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed because the female plug is slightly too large and my earphone plug will not stay in this adapter without tape. My earphones do not have an issue with any other jacks or adapters.
customer_reviews.author: B Young

customer_reviews.title: Kinda works...
customer_reviews.text: While it does work, the mic input is incredibly quiet from my PS4 headset and requires significant boasting. The stereo output is okay, but the connection itself with the headset doesn't always work and requires me to rotate the headphone in the jack to get a connection. For 8 bucks, I'm tempted to return it since it is not reliable :/
customer_reviews.author: JWatson

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This 1x 3.5mm Female to 2X 3.5mm Male Headset Adapter works like it should. Mic and sound come through as clear as possible. Using it on a HyperX Cloud II headset (Since the USB controller for the headset was starting to have issues after 2 years of use.) Wish there could be a tad longer option since I have it hooked up to the back of my desktop. But it works fine with a male to female extension.
customer_reviews.author: TaterStang

customer_reviews.title: Works great...for a while.
customer_reviews.text: I used this adapter less than 10 times over the course of a year before the headphone signal became intermittent. I tracked the problem to the cable coming from the green plug. If I wiggled it ever so slightly the audio would come & go. When using it the cable was never stressed or bent sharply. Until that happened I was very happy with this adapter. So 2 stars due to the poor quality of the cables.
customer_reviews.author: greenthumb

customer_reviews.title: INPUT CABLES ARE NOT 3 FT
customer_reviews.text: BOTH CABLES ARE NOT 3FT LONG. Be careful when you buy this. If you need the extra length for BOTH the mic and headphone inputs LOOK ELSEWHERE.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Great splitter
customer_reviews.text: I used this product to replace a broken headset adapter splitter. It arrived on time, the packaging was simple and not excessive, and the product was whole and in working order. I really appreciate the short length of the adapter in total because the previous product I used was too long and it kept getting caught on things. It functions well and the sound quality is very good. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: excellent material quality
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace a similar cable from a competitor that just isn't built as well. This one is made from way nicer materials and is among the best I've seen on the market for this product type. For some reason most of what's out there is built really cheap
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Ward

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for hooking earbuds to a PC
customer_reviews.text: A lot of PCs have two separate plugs for sound -- one for microphone and one for audio. This handy thingy plugs into each of those, and then you plug your earbuds or mic'd headset that only has one plug going out right into it and Voila, you're talking and listening thru your earbuds or whatever. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: btagsTop Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: Worked well - then in 1 month, hissing, cut-outs, and crackling
customer_reviews.text: This worked fine for connecting my mic'ed headphones with my laptop for Zoom calls etc -- for a month. Now it is functioning intermittently. Fail.
customer_reviews.author: Shimada Kanbei

customer_reviews.title: Just what i needed
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly for my PS4 headset to my computer. Mic and audio works. i would like to say i thought i had it connected all the way, but realized it needed to be pushed in a few centimeters more into the plug in.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro

customer_reviews.title: Works just like I wanted it to.
customer_reviews.text: I am using this cable with the front audio jacks on my desktop. I like the apparent quality of this cables construction. It has a lifetime warranty. I find that some what reassuring. So far performs exactly as I expected it too. I recommend to all.
customer_reviews.author: old-et

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: This looks like it would be a good product but it is not. It quit working after about three times of plugging the headphones into it. Tried a different one from my other computer and it worked perfectly fine.
customer_reviews.author: Dilbert

customer_reviews.title: Fixed Sound Input/Output Issues on My PC
customer_reviews.text: After building my PC the splitter it came with wasn't working, most likely because it wasn't the correct one for both input from my mic and output to my headset. Once I used this splitter I could get audio from my games and other applications and my voice could be heard through the microphone.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Johnson III

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointing - Did not worked as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Only the line out worked, I could hear the sound from laptop just fine but the 'line in' (microphone) did not work, people could not hear me during call. I tested different headsets but same problem. I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Tahir Rafiq

customer_reviews.title: soft cable, works after a few months
customer_reviews.text: for some reason the splitter i stole from my work only outputs audio to the right channel, so i needed a new splitter, this one worked great, the colors are nice and bold, the felt is something i wish they would do with every cable, the sound is unchanged. i would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Vince Coghlan

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: I needed a splitter for my Turtle Beach gaming headset so that I could use the headphones and mic at the same time on my Sager laptop. I've had it for two months now and it works very well and feels relatively sturdy. The wires are covered in a flexible cloth weave that I thought was nice, also. I didn't have to do anything to adjust sound input or output. It just worked right out of the box. I'm very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Great product with Mic’d Headset!
customer_reviews.text: Adapter arrived quickly! It works perfectly for our gaming PC. We got it to go with headphones with mic, so our kids could play fortnight with our neighbors. The headset had ‘3’ rings on the metal plug in and the adapter converts it so the mic can be activated.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen M.

customer_reviews.title: Fit the bill
customer_reviews.text: Bought this audio adapter cable for my nephew so he could use his headphone with microphone arm to talk while gaming. He received a new gaming PC as a Xmas gift which has a separate jack port each for listening and talking which required an adapter cable. This one fit the bill perfectly, he is extremely happy with it. Good quality item.
customer_reviews.author: Choot It!

customer_reviews.title: Happy son, sad mom.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two only received one. My son says it works great though. I am sad, the frustration is real. The one came packaged nicely and came quite quick.
customer_reviews.author: E. J. Small

customer_reviews.title: It's an adapter.
customer_reviews.text: Goes from the single 4 line 3.5mm to the dual inputs required by most PCs. It does it's job. No complaints. Cable seems to be holding up well. No static or anything.
customer_reviews.author: David Freed

customer_reviews.title: Good adapter for the price
customer_reviews.text: A simple adapter for any 3.5mm headphone, currently I'm using one of these for my PC, the cords have a outer layer of some type fiber. No kinks in the lines so I can say that these work out of the bag. I'd recommend them
customer_reviews.author: casey george

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Worked for an hour then nothing but static EDIT; They replaced the Adapter with a newer better one that works but is about 2 foot shorter than this one. I have updated rom 1 star to 3 stars since they did make things right.
customer_reviews.author: C. Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Works, good length
customer_reviews.text: Perfect length, worked with my headset without issue. I lost the one that came with my Headset and wanted to use my headset on my PC. The cable has a great look and feel to it, not like some of the inexpensive ones that look and feel cheaply made. The connectors fit tight, so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Works Great with my mic
customer_reviews.text: Needed to replace an old cord for my mic since I need my mic to work as I am a full time streamer. It arrived quickly and it was easy to just hook it up to my PC and test it. Everything works great with the mic, really well made. I'm pretty happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: L.A.

customer_reviews.title: It works as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: Item is performing exactly as it should with on issues whatsoever - i only gave it 3 stars for durability because I've only had it for a day - however the build quality is very good so I expect it to be durable as well .. Very pleased with this purchase and the seller!
customer_reviews.author: BA.

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Does what it's supposed to. Seems durable. I've used it probably 30 times plugging and unplugging, no issues yet.
customer_reviews.author: xavier villa

customer_reviews.title: Does not work!
customer_reviews.text: Would give it a zero. Doesn’t work at all, I tested my headphones with another one and they work just fine! This thing is trash. Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.author: LunarKitten

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Headset Adapter
customer_reviews.text: Worked as intended. Needed a new adapter to my gaming headset and works excellent. My only recommendation is I wish they had a happy medium of between the 8 inch and 3 foot adapter. Other than that this was by far the biggest bang for the buck. What was even crazy was that not none of the electronic stores carry an item like this in store.
customer_reviews.author: R.M

customer_reviews.title: Great sound!
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly and sound was very clear. Friends had no issue hearing me through the microphone.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Megan

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and effective
customer_reviews.text: The product does exactly what it is intended to do and does not dampen my audio or mic quality whatsoever. The construction seems sturdy enough and will hopefully not have any tearing issues down the line. Overall, I am very happy with my purchase for the time being.
customer_reviews.author: Patriot

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS ABSOLUTELY GARBAGE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I tested my earphone + microphone headset on my laptop right before using this, and it worked perfectly well. However, When I plugged it in my desktop, the microphone could not receive any audio except buzzing sounds. I later confirmed that it was this product's problem because everything works fine when I switched to my roommate's adapter. Do not recommend buying unless you still trust this after reading this review
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Great adaptor. Great value.
customer_reviews.text: Works as stated. No issues and now I can use my gaming headset for voice to text and commands on my PC. As an author this comes in very handy so I'm not killing my hands from typing cramps and I have a bit more freedom to move around with the longer cable compared to being confined and restricted to typing.
customer_reviews.author: M.E. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my skullcandy headphones
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for the skullcandy headphones I purchased during prime days. Works great, exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: jrios4177

customer_reviews.title: Transition from Xbox -> PC Complete!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what you’re looking for if you need headset compatibility for your PC. Works perfectly with my Turtlebeach headset, and the length is great because I can connect to the higher quality audio and mic connections on the motherboard instead of the ones on the front of the case. My only gripe is that it is short of the 3ft as advertised, but the “general idea” is there if that makes sense?!
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Does what it’s meant to do
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Bought this because my gaming pc has 2 ports for a mic and headphones but my headphones have a mic on them so I can only use one function at once. It works great and the sound quality is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Alexia

customer_reviews.title: generally just works
customer_reviews.text: not sure what else to say. it does its job. splits the input and output of a headset just fine. used it with two separate headsets: a plantronics earpiece and a set of kz2 iem's. works well.
customer_reviews.author: c

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with UiiSii DT200 Earbuds
customer_reviews.text: Bought this specifically to use UiiSii DT200 Earbuds with my desktop PC. Unfortunately, I get no sound or working mic. I tried reversing the mic and speaker ports to no avail. So I can't attest to the sound quality but build quality seems good. I threw away the packaging before testing which makes returning them impossible. Live and learn I suppose.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Works well for occasional video calls and game chat on my old laptop and desktop. I like that it's color-coded to easily distinguish microphone and headset. I don't have a complicated setup. Just plug the adapter into the mic and headphone ports on my laptop or desktop, and then plug in my 4-pole headset into the adapter.
customer_reviews.author: quacker

customer_reviews.title: The way to go
customer_reviews.text: I tried the usb converters and got random static very loudly in my head phones, When I switched to these I have not had one issue. Grab a pair of head phones with a mic built in, Plug these in to the head phone and mic jacks on our PC and bam !
customer_reviews.author: JMang

customer_reviews.title: Flawed from day one and didn't last
customer_reviews.text: From day one only worked in certain positions. After 2 months of use sound would only come from the left. Junk.
customer_reviews.author: Luckyimliving

customer_reviews.title: Extending the life of my old headset!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little worried when I ordered this that my old turtle beach for xbox one headset wasn’t CTIA. Once I plugged it in it worked fine though. Glad I went with the longer cord too as it gives me some room to maneuver without ripping the headset out of the adapter. Wire feels well made and sturdy. Obviously you can get these for much less than what I paid (about $8) but these seem like better quality compared to some of the other ones I’ve seen. Not to mention, if your current headset is working fine, the price of these is still much cheaper than buying a new headset.
customer_reviews.author: Chris R.

product_meta.title: MillSO Headset Splitter 3.5mm CTIA Jack Headset Adapter Mic and Audio Headphone Splitter Cable with Separate Microphone and Headphone Connector for Gaming Headset to PC - 8inch/20CM Black
feature_bullets: MillSO 3.5mm headset splitter split mic and audio: 1 x 4-position TRRS socket (black) to 2 x 3-position TRS 3.5 mm jack plug (green for TRS headphones, pink for TRS microphone).

This headset adapter is suitable for connecting a four-pole TRRS gaming headset in CTIA audio jack standard (audio & microphone) to a tablet, old version laptop, or PC Computer with separate microphone and audio connectors (NOT compatible with Apple Earphones, Bose headphones or Beats headset).
3.5mm headset audio splitter with universal interface works with VOIP applications, such as Skype or chat programs, MSN Messenger, Yahoo, Google Voice etc.
Gold-plated connectors ensure optimum sound quality. And bending resistance provides sufficient durability. Compact, yet robust design for maximum portability.

MillSO offers a 12-months unconditional Warranty for all our products to guard against any quality trouble. Please just contact our 24-hour customer support team via ❤️[support@millso.com]❤️ if you need any help.
